oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Military pass for W. T. Robinson
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Military police
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pass from the Provost Marshal's Office at Gallatin, Tennessee, to permit W. T. Robinson to travel within Federal lines until further orders. The pass was issued by order of Brigadier General E. A. Paine, and signed by Major J. J. Searitt, Provost Marshal.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- Provost Marshal's Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Military Provosts command the military police force of a designated area. Orders such as these were issued to prevent Federal guards and pickets from detaining as deserters or Confederate spies any friendly units with permission to travel .
